intro: Ricinus sanguineus, commonly known as the blood castor, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and unique, spiky seed capsules. The plant produces a red, sticky resin that has been traditionally used for medicinal and industrial purposes. Its growth habit includes both annual and perennial forms, depending on the climate. The species is also noted for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in arid environments.
